TCPWM_group03_DEADTIME

32'h00000184

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[15:0]

dt_line_out

0x0

In PWM_DT mode, this field is used to determine dead time beforeactivating the PWM line output signal "line_out": amount of deadtime cycles in the counter clock domain.In all other modes, the lower 3 bits of this field determinepre-scaling of the selected counter clock.0x0 : DIVBY1 : Divide by 1 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x1 : DIVBY2 : Divide by 2 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x2 : DIVBY4 : Divide by 4 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x3 : DIVBY8 : Divide by 8 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x4 : DIVBY16 : Divide by 16 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x5 : DIVBY32 : Divide by 32 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x6 : DIVBY64 : Divide by 64 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x7 : DIVBY128 : Divide by 128 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)

[31:16]

dt_line_compl_out

0x0

in PWM_DT mode, this field is used to determine the dead timebefore activating the complementary PWM line output signal"line_compl_out": amount of dead time cycles in the counterclock domain.In all other modes, this field has no effect.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group03_SEMA_CTRL

32'h00000188

there are two semaphores (sema#0 and sema#1) per counter, theyare used to synchronize counter operation and descriptor mastercfg automation, selected counter signal will be used to set thecorresponding semaphore, descriptor SYN command header infoSYN.op, SYN.msk_grp and SYN.msk will choose how to unset(clear) semaphore.

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[2:0]

sema0_sel

0x2

Selects one of the internal events to set sema#0.Default setting selects the terminal count event.0x0 : OVERFLOW : Overflow event0x1 : UNDERFLOW : Underflow event0x2 : TC : Terminal count event (default selection)0x3 : CC0_MATCH : Compare match 0 event0x4 : CC1_MATCH : Compare match 1 event0x5 : LINE_OUT : PWM output signal "line_out"0x6 : Reserved6 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x7: Disabled : no event is selected (0 is selected)

[3:3]

reserved_b3

0x0

[6:4]

sema1_sel

0x3

Selects one of the internal events to set sema#1.Default setting selects the terminal count event.0x0 : OVERFLOW : Overflow event0x1 : UNDERFLOW : Underflow event0x2 : TC : Terminal count event (default selection)0x3 : CC0_MATCH : Compare match 0 event0x4 : CC1_MATCH : Compare match 1 event0x5 : LINE_OUT : PWM output signal "line_out"0x6 : Reserved6 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x7: Disabled : no event is selected (0 is selected)

[7:7]

reserved_b7

0x0

Access

Register

Address

Description

(RW)

TCPWM_group03_SEMA_STS

32'h0000018C

used to indicate two semaphores bit status, both Hardware andSoftware can access: counter will set semaphore status when theevent defined by SEMA_CTRL occurs, SYN descriptor execution withOP code 4’b10 also set semaphore status; semaphore status iscleared when SYN descriptor with OP code 4’b11 is performed;Software can set semaphore status when an early SYN descriptortermination is required, this is useful during debug process.

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[0:0]

sema0_val

0x0

Indicate sema#0 status

[1:1]

sema1_val

0x0

Indicate sema#1 status

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group04_CLK_CTRL

32'h00000190

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[3:0]

clkdiv_sel

0x0

All TCPWM counter clock (the counter clock before active eventand prescaling) (including otrigClk used for counter outputtriggers) are generated by a group of clock dividers, thenumber of clock divider is controlled by design parameterCDIVNUM (which is set to 6 by default in design), the clocksource for all clock dividers is periClk from SoC.This 4-bit field is used to select the one out of CDIVNUM clockdividers to provide the clock enable signal which is combinedwith active event and prescaling together to generate thecounter’s operation clock in each of TCPWM counter. (otrigClkis only derived from clock divider)

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group04_CTRL

32'h00000194

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[0:0]

auto_reload_cc0

0x0

Specifies switching of the CC0 and buffered CC0 values. Thisfield has a function in TIMER, QUAD (QUAD_RANGE0_CMP,QUAD_RANGE1_CMP range modes), SR, PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes.Timer, QUAD, SR modes:'0': never switch.'1': switch on a compare match 0 event.PWM, PWM_DT, PWM_PR modes:'0: never switch.'1': switch on a terminal count event with an actively pendingswitch event.

[1:1]

auto_reload_cc1

0x0

Specifies switching of the CC1 and buffered CC1 values. Thisfield has a function in TIMER, QUAD (QUAD_RANGE0_CMP,QUAD_RANGE1_CMP range modes), SR, PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes.Timer, QUAD, SR modes:'0': never switch.'1': switch on a compare match 1 event.PWM, PWM_DT, PWM_PR modes:'0: never switch.'1': switch on a terminal count event with an actively pendingswitch event.

[2:2]

auto_reload_period

0x0

Specifies switching of the PERIOD and buffered PERIOD values.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_DT modes.'0': never switch.'1': switch on a terminal count event with and actively pendingswitch event.In QUAD mode, QUAD_RANGE0_CMP range mode this field is used toselect the index / wrap-around capture function.'0': Captures on index (reload) event. The counter value iscopied to the PERIOD register on an index (reload) event.'1': Captures when COUNTER equals 0 or 0xffff. The counter valueis copied to the PERIOD register when COUNTER equals 0 or0xffff.

[3:3]

auto_reload_line_sel

0x0

Specifies switching of the LINE_SEL and LINE_BUFF_SEL values.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_PR modes.'0': never switch.'1': switch on a terminal count event with and actively pendingswitch event.

[4:4]

cc0_match_up_en

0x1

Enables / disables the compare match 0 event generation (COUNTERequals CC0 register) when counting up (STATUS.DOWN = 0) inCNT_UPDN1/2 mode.'0': compare match 0 event generation disabled when counting up'1': compare match 0 event generation enabled when counting upThis field has a function in PWM and PWM_DT modes only.

[5:5]

cc0_match_down_en

0x1

Enables / disables the compare match 0 event generation (COUNTERequals CC0 register) when counting down (STATUS.DOWN = 1) inCNT_UPDN1/2 mode.'0': compare match 0 event generation disabled when countingdown'1': compare match 0 event generation enabled when counting downThis field has a function in PWM and PWM_DT modes only.

[6:6]

cc1_match_up_en

0x1

Enables / disables the compare match 1 event generation (COUNTERequals CC0 register) when counting up (STATUS.DOWN = 0) inCNT_UPDN1/2 mode.'0': compare match 1 event generation disabled when counting up'1': compare match 1 event generation enabled when counting upThis field has a function in PWM and PWM_DT modes only.

[7:7]

cc1_match_down_en

0x1

Enables / disables the compare match 1 event generation (COUNTERequals CC0 register) when counting down (STATUS.DOWN = 1) inCNT_UPDN1/2 mode.'0': compare match 1 event generation disabled when countingdown'1': compare match 1 event generation enabled when counting downThis field has a function in PWM and PWM_DT modes only.

[8:8]

pwm_imm_kill

0x0

Specifies whether the kill event immediately deactivates the"line_out" and "line_compl_out" signals or with the next moduleclock ("active count" pre-scaled counter clock).'0': synchronous kill activation. Deactivates the "line_out" and"line_compl_out" signals with the next module clock ("activecount" pre-scaled counter clock).'1': immediate kill activation. Immediately deactivates the"line_out" and "line_compl_out" signals.This field has a function in PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes only.

[9:9]

pwm_stop_on_kill

0x0

Specifies whether the counter stops on a kill events:'0': kill event does NOT stop counter.'1': kill event stops counter.This field has a function in PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes only.

[10:10]

pwm_sync_kill

0x0

Specifies asynchronous/synchronous kill release behavior:'1': synchronous kill mode: the kill event disables the"line_out" and "line_compl_out" signals till the next terminalcount event (synchronous kill). In synchronous kill mode,STOP_EDGE should be NO_EDGE_DET.'0': asynchronous kill mode: the kill event only disables the"line_out" and "line_compl_out" signals when present. Inasynchronous kill mode, STOP_EDGE should be NO_EDGE_DET.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_DT modes only. Thisfield is only used when PWM_STOP_ON_KILL is '0'.

[11:11]

reserved_b11

0x0

[13:12]

pwm_disable_mode

0x0

Specifies the behavior of the PWM outputs "line_out" and"line_compl_out" while the TCPWM counter is disabled(CTL.ENABLED='0') or stopped.Note: The output signal of this selection can be furthermodified by the immediate kill logic and line_out polaritysettings (CTRL.QUAD_ENCODING_MODE).0x0 : Z : When the counter is disabled the PWM outputs"line_out" and "line_compl_out" are NOT driven by the TCPWM.Instead the port default level configuration applies, e.g. "Z"(high impedance).Note: This is realized by driving the TCPWM output "line_out_en"to 0.When the counter is stopped upon a stop event the PWM outputsare deactivated (to the polarity defined byCTRL.QUAD_ENCODING_MODE).0x1 : RETAIN : When the counter is disabled the PWM outputs"line_out" and "line_compl_out" are driven by the TCPWM.When the counter is disabled or stopped upon a stop event thePWM outputs are retained (keep their previous levels).While the counter is disabled or stopped the PWM outputs can bechanged via LINE_SEL.0x2 : L : When the counter is disabled the PWM outputs"line_out" and "line_compl_out" are driven by the TCPWM.When the counter is disabled or stopped upon a stop event thePWM output "line_out" is driven as a fixed '0' and the PWMoutput "line_compl_out" is driven as a fixed '1'.0x3 : H : When the counter is disabled the PWM outputs"line_out" and "line_compl_out" are driven by the TCPWM.When the counter is disabled or stopped upon a stop event thePWM output "line_out" is driven as a fixed '1' and the PWMoutput "line_compl_out" is driven as a fixed '0'.

[15:14]

reserved_b14to15

0x0

[17:16]

up_down_mode

0x0

Determines counter direction.In QUAD mode this field acts as QUAD_RANGE_MODE field selectingbetween different counter range, reload value and compare /capture behavior.0x0 : COUNT_UP : Count up (to PERIOD). An overflow event isgenerated when the counter changes from a state in whichCOUNTER equals PERIOD. A terminal count event is generated whenthe counter changes from a state in which COUNTER equals PERIOD.0x0 : QUAD_RANGE0 : In QUAD mode this setting selects theQUAD_RANGE0 mode with the following behavior:- COUNTER range is between 0x0000 and 0xFFFF / 0xFFFFFFFF (forCNTWIDTH = 16 / 32)- on reload / index event:- CC0 is copied to CC0_BUFF- COUNTER is copied to CC0- COUNTER is set to midpoint (0x8000 / 0x80000000)- tc and cc0_match events are generated- when COUNTER is 0x0000 or 0xFFFF / 0xFFFFFFFF:- CC0 is copied to CC0_BUFF- COUNTER (0x0000 or 0xFFFF / 0xFFFFFFFF) is copied to CC0- COUNTER is set to midpoint (0x8000 / 0x80000000)- cc0_match event is generated0x1 : COUNT_DOWN : Count down (to "0"). An underflow event isgenerated when the counter changes from a state in whichCOUNTER equals "0". A terminal count event is generated whenthe counter changes from a state in which COUNTER equals "0".0x1 : QUAD_RANGE0_CMP : In QUAD mode this setting selects theQUAD_RANGE0_CMP mode with the following behavior:- COUNTER range is between 0x0000 and 0xFFFF / 0xFFFFFFFF (forCNTWIDTH = 16 / 32)- the capture0 event acts as 2nd reload / index event- on reload / index event:- COUNTER is set to midpoint (0x8000 / 0x80000000)- when 'capture on index' is selected (AUTO_RELOAD_PERIOD=0):- tc event is generated- PERIOD is copied to PERIOD_BUFF- COUNTER is copied to PERIOD- when COUNTER is 0x0000 or 0xFFFF / 0xFFFFFFFF:- COUNTER is set to midpoint (0x8000 / 0x80000000)- when 'capture on wrap-around' is selected(AUTO_RELOAD_PERIOD=1):- tc event is generated- PERIOD is copied to PERIOD_BUFF- COUNTER (0x0000 or 0xFFFF / 0xFFFFFFFF) is copied to PERIOD- 1 or 2 compare functions (depending on CC1_PRESENT) availableBecause of that the PERIOD/PERIOD_BUFF registers are usedinstead of CC0/CC_BUFF registers to capture COUNTER at reload /index event or wrap-around.0x2 : COUNT_UPDN1 : Count up (to PERIOD), then count down (to"0"). An overflow event is generated when the counter changesfrom a state in which COUNTER equals PERIOD. An underflow eventis generated when the counter changes from a state in whichCOUNTER equals "0". A terminal count event is generated whenthe counter changes from a state in which COUNTER equals "0".0x2 : QUAD_RANGE1_CAPT : In QUAD mode this setting selects theQUAD_RANGE1_CAPT mode with the following behavior:- COUNTER range is between 0x0000 and PERIOD- on reload / index event:- COUNTER is set to 0x0000- tc event is generated- when COUNTER is 0x0000 and decrementing:- COUNTER is set to PERIOD- tc event is generated- when COUNTER equals PERIOD and is incrementing:- COUNTER is set to 0x0000- tc event is generated- 1 or 2 capture functions (depending on CC1_PRESENT) available- on capture0 / capture1 event:- CC0 / CC1 is copied to CC0_BUFF / CC1_BUFF- COUNTER value is copied to CC0It allows that the COUNTER register reflects the current angleposition of the rotary encoder, i.e. no MOD or SUB calculationsneed to be done in SW on the COUNTER value to get the currentangle position. This allows a DMA copy of the angle positionfrom the COUNTER register. However, a disadvantage of this modeis that fast sequences of tc interrupts can occur (when encodermoves back and forth around start position). It is recommendedto not use the tc interrupt in this mode.0x3 : COUNT_UPDN2 : Count up (to PERIOD), then count down (to"0"). An overflow event is generated when the counter changesfrom a state in which COUNTER equals PERIOD. An underflow eventis generated when the counter changes from a state in whichCOUNTER equals "0". A terminal count event is generated whenthe counter changes from a state in which COUNTER equals "0"AND when the counter changes from a state in which COUNTERequals PERIOD (this counter direction can be used for PWMfunctionality with asymmetrical updates).0x3 : QUAD_RANGE1_CMP : In QUAD mode this setting selects theQUAD_RANGE1_CMP mode.The behavior is the same as for QUAD_RANGE1_CAPT mode describedabove with the only difference that 1 or 2 compare functions(depending on CC1_PRESENT) are available instead of 1 or 2capture functions.

[18:18]

one_shot

0x0

When '0', counter runs continuous. When '1', counter is turnedoff by hardware when a terminal count event is generated.

[19:19]

reserved_b19

0x0

[21:20]

quad_encoding_mode

0x0

In QUAD mode this field selects the quadrature encoding mode(X1/X2/X4) or the Up / Down rotary counting mode.In PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes, these two bits can be used toinvert "line_out" and "line_compl_out". Inversion is the laststep in generation of "line_out" and "line_compl_out"; i.e. adisabled output line "line_out" has the valueQUAD_ENCODING_MODE[0] and a disabled output line"line_compl_out" has the value QUAD_ENCODING_MODE[1].0x0 : X1 : X1 encoding (QUAD mode)This encoding is identical with an up / down countingfunctionality of the following way: Rising edges of input phiAincrement or decrement the counter depending on the state ofinput phiB (direction input).0x1 : X2 : X2 encoding (QUAD mode)0x1 : INV_OUT : When bit 0 is '1', QUADRATURE_ENCODING_MODE[0]inverts "line_out" (PWM/PWM_DT modes)0x2 : X4 : X4 encoding (QUAD mode)0x2 : INV_COMPL_OUT : When bit 1 is '1',QUADRATURE_ENCODING_MODE[1] inverts "line_compl_out"(PWM/PWM_DT modes)0x3 : UP_DOWN : Up / Down rotary counting mode. Input phiAincrements the counter, input phiB decrements the counter. Thetrigger edge detection settings apply.

[23:22]

reserved_b22tob23

0x0

[26:24]

mode

0x0

Counter mode.0x0 : TIMER : Timer mode0x1 : Reserved1 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x2 : CAPTURE : Capture mode0x3 : QUAD : Quadrature modeDifferent encoding modes can be selected by QUAD_ENCODING_MODEincluding up/down count functionality.Different counter range, reload value and capture behavior canbe selected by QUAD_RANGE_MODE (overloaded field UP_DOWN_MODE).0x4 : PWM : Pulse width modulation (PWM) mode0x5 : PWM_DT : PWM with deadtime insertion mode0x6 : PWM_PR : Pseudo random pulse width modulation0x7 : SR : Shift register mode.

[29:27]

reserved_b27tob29

0x0

[30:30]

dbg_freeze_en

0x0

Specifies the counter behavior in debug mode.'0': The counter operation continues in debug mode.'1': The counter operation freezes in debug mode.

[31:31]

enabled

0x0

Counter enable.'0': counter disabled.'1': counter enabled.Counter static configuration information (e.g. CTRL.mode, allTRIN_CTRL0/1, TRIN_EDGE_SEL, PWM_CTRL and TROUT_SEL registerfields) should only be modified when the counter is disabled.When a counter is disabled, command and status informationassociated to the counter is cleared by HW, this includes:- the associated counter triggers in the CMD register are set to'0'.- the counter's interrupt cause fields in counter's INTRregister.- the counter's status fields in counter's STATUS register..- the counter's trigger outputs ("tr_out0" and tr_out1").- the counter's line outputs ("line_out" and "line_compl_out").

Access

Register

Address

Description

(R-)

TCPWM_group04_STATUS

32'h00000198

When the counter is disabled (CTRL.enabled = 0), then theSTATUS.tr_* bit fields are typically reset to their defaultvalues. However, there are exceptions possible in the followingcases, based on the selected input trigger via TRIN_SEL*.*_sel:- If a constant '0' is selected, then a '0' is read.- If a constant '1' is selected, then a '1' is read.

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[0:0]

down

0x0

When '0', counter is counting up. When '1', counter is countingdown. In QUAD mode, this field indicates the direction of thelatest counter change: '0' when last incremented and '1' whenlast decremented.

[3:1]

reserved_b1tob3

0x0

[4:4]

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the selected capture 0 trigger.

[5:5]

tr_count

0x1

Indicates the actual level of the selected count trigger.

[6:6]

tr_reload

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the selected reload trigger.

[7:7]

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the selected stop trigger.

[8:8]

tr_start

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the selected start trigger.

[9:9]

tr_capture1

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the selected capture 1 trigger.

[10:10]

line_out

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the PWM line output signal.

[11:11]

line_compl_out

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the complementary PWM line outputsignal

[14:12]

reserved_b12tob14

0x0

[15:15]

running

0x0

When '0', the counter is NOT running. When '1', the counter isrunning.This field is used to indicate that the counter is running aftera start/reload event and that the counter is stopped after astop event.When a running counter operation is paused in debug state (seeCTRL.dbg_pause) then the RUNNING bit is still '1'.

[31:16]

dt_cnt

0x0

Generic 16-bit counter field. In PWM_DT mode, this counter isused for dead time insertion on PWM line_outIn all other modes, this counter is used for pre-scaling theselected counter clock. PWM_DT mode can NOT use prescaled clockfunctionality.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(RW)

TCPWM_group04_CC0

32'h0000019C

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[31:0]

cc0

0xFFFFFFFF

In CAPTURE mode, captures the counter value. In other modes,compared to counter value.Note1: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register withthe internal real value used by counting operation for SW’spurpose under any one of the following conditions:1. SW reads this register when the counter is enabled(CTRL.enabled = 1) already; or2. SW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;Note2: if TCPWM counter is configured as a 16-bit counter, thisregister has bit [15:0] valid only, bit [31:16] is not used.

[31:0]

period

0xFFFFFFFF

The maximum value the counter can reach. When the counter isdesigned to count for n cycles, this field should be set ton-1.Note1: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register withthe internal real value used by counting operation for SW’spurpose under any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;Note2: if TCPWM counter is configured as a 16-bit counter, thisregister has bit [15:0] valid only, bit [31:16] is not used.

val

0x0

32-bit counter value. It is advised to not write to the thisfield when the counter is running.TCPWM counter can only be initialized by software in PWM_PR andSR mode.Note1: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register withthe internal real value used by counting operation for SW’spurpose under any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;Note2: if TCPWM counter is configured as a 16-bit counter, thisregister has bit [15:0] valid only, bit [31:16] is not used.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group04_PWM_CTRL

32'h000001AC

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[1:0]

cc0_match_mode

0x3

Determines the effect of a compare match 0 event (COUNTER equalsCC0 register) on the "line" output signals. Note that INVERT isespecially useful for center aligned pulse width modulation.To generate a duty cycle of 0%, the counter CC0 register shouldbe set to "0". For a 100% duty cycle, the counter CC0 registershould be set to larger than the counter PERIOD register.

[3:2]

overflow_mode

0x3

Determines the effect of a counter overflow event (COUNTERreaches PERIOD) on the "line_out" output signals.

[5:4]

underflow_mode

0x3

Determines the effect of a counter underflow event (COUNTERreaches "0") on the "line_out" output signals.

[7:6]

cc1_match_mode

0x3

Determines the effect of a compare match 1 event (COUNTER equalsCC1 register) on the "line_out" output signals.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(RW)

TCPWM_group04_LINE_SEL

32'h000001B0

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[2:0]

out_sel

0x2

Selects the source for the output signal "line_out". Defaultsetting is the PWM signal "line". Other settings are useful forStepper Motor Control.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_PR modes only.Note: The output signal of this selection can be furthermodified by the stop / kill logic and line_out polarity setting(CTRL.quad_encoding_mode[0]).0x0 : L : fixed '0'0x1 : H : fixed '1'0x2 : PWM : PWM signal "line"0x3 : PWM_INV : inverted PWM signal "line"0x4 : Z : The output "line_out" is not driven by the TCPWM.Instead the port default level configuration applies, e.g. "Z"(high impedance).Note: This is realized by driving the output "line_out_en" to 0.0x5 : Reserved5 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x6 : Reserved6 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x7 : Reserved7 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.Note: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register with theinternal real value used by counting operation for SW’s purposeunder any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;

[3:3]

reserved_b3

0x0

[6:4]

compl_out_sel

0x3

Selects the source for the output signal "line_compl_out".Default setting is the inverted PWM signal "line". Othersettings are useful for Stepper Motor Control.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_PR modes only.Note: The output signal of this selection can be furthermodified by the stop / kill logic and line_compl_out polaritysetting (CTRL.quad_encoding_mode[1]).0x0 : L : fixed '0'0x1 : H : fixed '1'0x2 : PWM : PWM signal "line"0x3 : PWM_INV : inverted PWM signal "line"0x4 : Z : The output "line_compl_out" is not driven by theTCPWM. Instead the port default level configuration applies,e.g. "Z" (high impedance).Note: This is realized by driving the output "line_compl_out_en"to 0.0x5 : Reserved5 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x6 : Reserved6 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x7 : Reserved7 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.Note: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register with theinternal real value used by counting operation for SW’s purposeunder any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;

Access

Register

Address

Description

(RW)

TCPWM_group04_PERIOD_BUFF

32'h000001BC

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[31:0]

period_buff

0xFFFFFFFF

Additional buffer for counter PERIOD register.In PWM_PR mode PEROD_BUFF defines the LFSR polynomial. Each bitrepresents a tap of the shift register which can be feed backto the MSB of counter via an XOR tree.Examples for CNTWIDTH = 16:- Maximum length 16bit LFSR- polynomial x^16 + x^14 + x^13 + x^11 + 1- taps 0,2,3,5 - > PERIOD_BUFF = 0x002d- period is 2^16-1 = 65535 cycles- Maximum length 8bit LFSR:- polynomial x^8 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + 1- taps 8,10,11,12 (realized in 8 MSBs of 16bit LFSR)- period is 2^8-1 = 255 cyclesIn SR mode PERIOD_BUFF defines which tap of the shift registergenerates the PWM output signals. For a delay of n cycles (fromcapture event to PWM output) the bit CNT_WIDTH-n should be setto '1'. For a shift register function only one tap should beuse, i.e. a one-hot value must be written to PERIOD_BUFF. Ifmultiple bits in PERIOD_BUFF are set then the taps are XORcombined.Note1: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register withthe internal real value used by counting operation for SW’spurpose under any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;Note2: if TCPWM counter is configured as a 16-bit counter, thisregister has bit [15:0] valid only, bit [31:16] is not used.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(RW)

TCPWM_group04_LINE_SEL_BUFF

32'h000001C0

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[2:0]

out_sel

0x2

Buffer for LINE_SEL.OUT_SEL.Can be exchanged with LINE_SEL.out_sel on a terminal count eventwith an actively pending switch event.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_PR modes only.Note: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register with theinternal real value used by counting operation for SW’s purposeunder any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;

[3:3]

reserved_b3

0x0

[6:4]

compl_out_sel

0x3

Buffer for LINE_SEL.COMPL.OUT_SEL.Can be exchanged with LINE_SEL.compl_out_sel on a terminal countevent with an actively pending switch event.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_PR modes only.Note: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register with theinternal real value used by counting operation for SW’s purposeunder any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group04_TRIN_CTRL0

32'h000001C4

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[7:0]

capture0_sel

0x0

Selects one of the up to 256 input triggers as a capture0trigger. Input trigger 0 is always '0' and input trigger 1 isalways '1'.In the PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes this trigger is used toswitch the values of the compare and period registers withtheir buffer counterparts.

[15:8]

count_sel

0x1

Selects one of the 256 input triggers as a count trigger.In QUAD mode, this is the first phase (phi A). Default settingselects input trigger 1, which is always '1'.Note: In the modes: TIMER, CAPTURE, PWM, PWM_DT, and SR, If thecounter is externally triggered ( COUNT_SEL > 1), an externaltrigger will be required for each TR_CMD to execute. Forexample, a write to TR_CMD.START will not start the counteruntil the trigger selected by COUNT_SEL asserts. The nexttrigger will increment the counter since the counter is nowrunning. This goes for all TR_CMD fields.

[23:16]

reload_sel

0x0

Selects one of the 256 input triggers as a reload trigger.In QUAD mode, this is the index or revolution pulse. In thesemodes, it will update the counter with 0x8000 (countermidpoint) or 0x0000 depending on the QUAD_RANGE_MODE.

[31:24]

stop_sel

0x0

Selects one of the 256 input triggers as a stop trigger.In PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes, this is the kill trigger. Inthese modes, the kill trigger is used to either temporarilyblock the PWM outputs (PWM_STOP_ON_KILL is '0') or stop thefunctionality (PWM_STOP_ON_KILL is '1'). For the PWM and PWM_DTmodes, the blocking of the output signals can be asynchronous(STOP_EDGE should be NO_EDGE_DET) in which case the blocking isas long as the trigger is '1' or synchronous (STOP_EDGE shouldbe RISING_EDGE) in which case it extends till the next terminalcount event.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group04_TRIN_CTRL1

32'h000001C8

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[7:0]

start_sel

0x0

Selects one of the 256 input triggers as a start trigger. InQUAD mode, this is the second phase (phi B).

[15:8]

capture1_sel

0x0

Selects one of the 256 input triggers as a capture 1 trigger.

[16:16]

capture0_inv

0x0

Input trigger capture0 will be inverted before counter usage.

[17:17]

count_inv

0x0

Input trigger count will be inverted before counter usage

[18:18]

reload_inv

0x0

Input trigger reload will be inverted before counter usage

[19:19]

stop_inv

0x0

Input trigger stop will be inverted before counter usage

[20:20]

start_inv

0x0

Input trigger start will be inverted before counter usage

[21:21]

capture1_inv

0x0

Input trigger capture1 will be inverted before counter usage

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group04_TRIN_EDGE_SEL

32'h000001CC

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[1:0]

capture0_edge

0x3

0x0: RISING_EDGE, any rising edge generates an event.0x1: FALLING_EDGE, any falling edge generates an event.0x2: ANY_EDGE, any odd amount of edges generates an event.0x3: NO_EDGE_DET, no edge detection, use trigger as is.

[3:2]

count_edge

0x3

0x0: RISING_EDGE, any rising edge generates an event.0x1: FALLING_EDGE, any falling edge generates an event.0x2: ANY_EDGE, any odd amount of edges generates an event.0x3: NO_EDGE_DET, no edge detection, use trigger as is.

[5:4]

reload_edge

0x3

0x0: RISING_EDGE, any rising edge generates an event.0x1: FALLING_EDGE, any falling edge generates an event.0x2: ANY_EDGE, any odd amount of edges generates an event.0x3: NO_EDGE_DET, no edge detection, use trigger as is.

[7:6]

stop_edge

0x3

0x0: RISING_EDGE, any rising edge generates an event.0x1: FALLING_EDGE, any falling edge generates an event.0x2: ANY_EDGE, any odd amount of edges generates an event.0x3: NO_EDGE_DET, no edge detection, use trigger as is.

[9:8]

start_edge

0x3

0x0: RISING_EDGE, any rising edge generates an event.0x1: FALLING_EDGE, any falling edge generates an event.0x2: ANY_EDGE, any odd amount of edges generates an event.0x3: NO_EDGE_DET, no edge detection, use trigger as is.

[11:10]

capture1_edge

0x3

0x0: RISING_EDGE, any rising edge generates an event.0x1: FALLING_EDGE, any falling edge generates an event.0x2: ANY_EDGE, any odd amount of edges generates an event.0x3: NO_EDGE_DET, no edge detection, use trigger as is.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group04_TROUT_SEL

32'h000001D0

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[2:0]

out0

0x2

Selects one of the internal events to generate the outputtrigger 0. Default setting selects the terminal count event.0x0 : OVERFLOW: Overflow event0x1 : UNDERFLOW: Underflow event0x2 : TC: Terminal count event (default selection)0x3 : CC0_MATCH: Compare match 0 event0x4 : CC1_MATCH: Compare match 1 event0x5 : LINE_OUT: PWM output signal "line_out"0x6 : Reserved6: This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x7: Disabled: Output trigger disabled.

[3:3]

reserved_3

0x0

[6:4]

out1

0x3

Selects one of the internal events to generate the outputtrigger 1. Default setting selects the compare match 0 event.0x0 : OVERFLOW: Overflow event0x1 : UNDERFLOW: Underflow event0x2 : TC: Terminal count event0x3 : CC0_MATCH: Compare match 0 event (default selection)0x4 : CC1_MATCH: Compare match 1 event0x5 : LINE_OUT: PWM output signal "line_out"0x6 : Reserved6: This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x7 : Disabled: Output trigger disabled.

[7:7]

0x0

(RW)

TCPWM_group04_TR_CMD

32'h000001D4

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[0:0]

capture0

0x0

SW capture 0 trigger. When written with '1', a capture 0 triggeris generated and the HW sets the field to '0' when the SWtrigger has taken effect. It should be noted that the HWoperates on the counter frequency. If the counter is disabledthrough CTRL.ENABLED, the field is immediately set to '0'.

[1:1]

reserved_1

0x0

[2:2]

reload

0x0

SW reload trigger. For HW behavior, see capture0 field.

[3:3]

stop

0x0

SW stop trigger. For HW behavior, see capture0 field.

[4:4]

start

0x0

SW start trigger. For HW behavior, see capture0 field.

[5:5]

capture1

0x0

SW capture1 trigger. For HW behavior, see capture0 field.

tc

0x0

[1:1]

[2:2]

cc1_match

0x0

Set to 1 when the counter value matches capture/compare1 (CC1)register value, write ‘1’ to clear this bit

TCPWM_group04_DEADTIME

32'h000001E8

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[15:0]

dt_line_out

0x0

In PWM_DT mode, this field is used to determine dead time beforeactivating the PWM line output signal "line_out": amount of deadtime cycles in the counter clock domain.In all other modes, the lower 3 bits of this field determinepre-scaling of the selected counter clock.0x0 : DIVBY1 : Divide by 1 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x1 : DIVBY2 : Divide by 2 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x2 : DIVBY4 : Divide by 4 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x3 : DIVBY8 : Divide by 8 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x4 : DIVBY16 : Divide by 16 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x5 : DIVBY32 : Divide by 32 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x6 : DIVBY64 : Divide by 64 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)0x7 : DIVBY128 : Divide by 128 (other-than-PWM_DT mode)

[31:16]

dt_line_compl_out

0x0

in PWM_DT mode, this field is used to determine the dead timebefore activating the complementary PWM line output signal"line_compl_out": amount of dead time cycles in the counterclock domain.In all other modes, this field has no effect.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group04_SEMA_CTRL

32'h000001EC

there are two semaphores (sema#0 and sema#1) per counter, theyare used to synchronize counter operation and descriptor mastercfg automation, selected counter signal will be used to set thecorresponding semaphore, descriptor SYN command header infoSYN.op, SYN.msk_grp and SYN.msk will choose how to unset(clear) semaphore.

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[2:0]

sema0_sel

0x2

Selects one of the internal events to set sema#0.Default setting selects the terminal count event.0x0 : OVERFLOW : Overflow event0x1 : UNDERFLOW : Underflow event0x2 : TC : Terminal count event (default selection)0x3 : CC0_MATCH : Compare match 0 event0x4 : CC1_MATCH : Compare match 1 event0x5 : LINE_OUT : PWM output signal "line_out"0x6 : Reserved6 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x7: Disabled : no event is selected (0 is selected)

[3:3]

reserved_b3

0x0

[6:4]

sema1_sel

0x3

Selects one of the internal events to set sema#1.Default setting selects the terminal count event.0x0 : OVERFLOW : Overflow event0x1 : UNDERFLOW : Underflow event0x2 : TC : Terminal count event (default selection)0x3 : CC0_MATCH : Compare match 0 event0x4 : CC1_MATCH : Compare match 1 event0x5 : LINE_OUT : PWM output signal "line_out"0x6 : Reserved6 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x7: Disabled : no event is selected (0 is selected)

[7:7]

reserved_b7

0x0

Access

Register

Address

Description

(RW)

TCPWM_group04_SEMA_STS

32'h000001F0

used to indicate two semaphores bit status, both Hardware andSoftware can access: counter will set semaphore status when theevent defined by SEMA_CTRL occurs, SYN descriptor execution withOP code 4’b10 also set semaphore status; semaphore status iscleared when SYN descriptor with OP code 4’b11 is performed;Software can set semaphore status when an early SYN descriptortermination is required, this is useful during debug process.

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[0:0]

sema0_val

0x0

Indicate sema#0 status

[1:1]

sema1_val

0x0

Indicate sema#1 status

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group05_CLK_CTRL

32'h000001F4

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[3:0]

clkdiv_sel

0x0

All TCPWM counter clock (the counter clock before active eventand prescaling) (including otrigClk used for counter outputtriggers) are generated by a group of clock dividers, thenumber of clock divider is controlled by design parameterCDIVNUM (which is set to 6 by default in design), the clocksource for all clock dividers is periClk from SoC.This 4-bit field is used to select the one out of CDIVNUM clockdividers to provide the clock enable signal which is combinedwith active event and prescaling together to generate thecounter’s operation clock in each of TCPWM counter. (otrigClkis only derived from clock divider)

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group05_CTRL

32'h000001F8

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[0:0]

auto_reload_cc0

0x0

Specifies switching of the CC0 and buffered CC0 values. Thisfield has a function in TIMER, QUAD (QUAD_RANGE0_CMP,QUAD_RANGE1_CMP range modes), SR, PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes.Timer, QUAD, SR modes:'0': never switch.'1': switch on a compare match 0 event.PWM, PWM_DT, PWM_PR modes:'0: never switch.'1': switch on a terminal count event with an actively pendingswitch event.

[1:1]

auto_reload_cc1

0x0

Specifies switching of the CC1 and buffered CC1 values. Thisfield has a function in TIMER, QUAD (QUAD_RANGE0_CMP,QUAD_RANGE1_CMP range modes), SR, PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes.Timer, QUAD, SR modes:'0': never switch.'1': switch on a compare match 1 event.PWM, PWM_DT, PWM_PR modes:'0: never switch.'1': switch on a terminal count event with an actively pendingswitch event.

[2:2]

auto_reload_period

0x0

Specifies switching of the PERIOD and buffered PERIOD values.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_DT modes.'0': never switch.'1': switch on a terminal count event with and actively pendingswitch event.In QUAD mode, QUAD_RANGE0_CMP range mode this field is used toselect the index / wrap-around capture function.'0': Captures on index (reload) event. The counter value iscopied to the PERIOD register on an index (reload) event.'1': Captures when COUNTER equals 0 or 0xffff. The counter valueis copied to the PERIOD register when COUNTER equals 0 or0xffff.

[3:3]

auto_reload_line_sel

0x0

Specifies switching of the LINE_SEL and LINE_BUFF_SEL values.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_PR modes.'0': never switch.'1': switch on a terminal count event with and actively pendingswitch event.

[4:4]

cc0_match_up_en

0x1

Enables / disables the compare match 0 event generation (COUNTERequals CC0 register) when counting up (STATUS.DOWN = 0) inCNT_UPDN1/2 mode.'0': compare match 0 event generation disabled when counting up'1': compare match 0 event generation enabled when counting upThis field has a function in PWM and PWM_DT modes only.

[5:5]

cc0_match_down_en

0x1

Enables / disables the compare match 0 event generation (COUNTERequals CC0 register) when counting down (STATUS.DOWN = 1) inCNT_UPDN1/2 mode.'0': compare match 0 event generation disabled when countingdown'1': compare match 0 event generation enabled when counting downThis field has a function in PWM and PWM_DT modes only.

[6:6]

cc1_match_up_en

0x1

Enables / disables the compare match 1 event generation (COUNTERequals CC0 register) when counting up (STATUS.DOWN = 0) inCNT_UPDN1/2 mode.'0': compare match 1 event generation disabled when counting up'1': compare match 1 event generation enabled when counting upThis field has a function in PWM and PWM_DT modes only.

[7:7]

cc1_match_down_en

0x1

Enables / disables the compare match 1 event generation (COUNTERequals CC0 register) when counting down (STATUS.DOWN = 1) inCNT_UPDN1/2 mode.'0': compare match 1 event generation disabled when countingdown'1': compare match 1 event generation enabled when counting downThis field has a function in PWM and PWM_DT modes only.

[8:8]

pwm_imm_kill

0x0

Specifies whether the kill event immediately deactivates the"line_out" and "line_compl_out" signals or with the next moduleclock ("active count" pre-scaled counter clock).'0': synchronous kill activation. Deactivates the "line_out" and"line_compl_out" signals with the next module clock ("activecount" pre-scaled counter clock).'1': immediate kill activation. Immediately deactivates the"line_out" and "line_compl_out" signals.This field has a function in PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes only.

[9:9]

pwm_stop_on_kill

0x0

Specifies whether the counter stops on a kill events:'0': kill event does NOT stop counter.'1': kill event stops counter.This field has a function in PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes only.

[10:10]

pwm_sync_kill

0x0

Specifies asynchronous/synchronous kill release behavior:'1': synchronous kill mode: the kill event disables the"line_out" and "line_compl_out" signals till the next terminalcount event (synchronous kill). In synchronous kill mode,STOP_EDGE should be NO_EDGE_DET.'0': asynchronous kill mode: the kill event only disables the"line_out" and "line_compl_out" signals when present. Inasynchronous kill mode, STOP_EDGE should be NO_EDGE_DET.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_DT modes only. Thisfield is only used when PWM_STOP_ON_KILL is '0'.

[11:11]

reserved_b11

0x0

[13:12]

pwm_disable_mode

0x0

Specifies the behavior of the PWM outputs "line_out" and"line_compl_out" while the TCPWM counter is disabled(CTL.ENABLED='0') or stopped.Note: The output signal of this selection can be furthermodified by the immediate kill logic and line_out polaritysettings (CTRL.QUAD_ENCODING_MODE).0x0 : Z : When the counter is disabled the PWM outputs"line_out" and "line_compl_out" are NOT driven by the TCPWM.Instead the port default level configuration applies, e.g. "Z"(high impedance).Note: This is realized by driving the TCPWM output "line_out_en"to 0.When the counter is stopped upon a stop event the PWM outputsare deactivated (to the polarity defined byCTRL.QUAD_ENCODING_MODE).0x1 : RETAIN : When the counter is disabled the PWM outputs"line_out" and "line_compl_out" are driven by the TCPWM.When the counter is disabled or stopped upon a stop event thePWM outputs are retained (keep their previous levels).While the counter is disabled or stopped the PWM outputs can bechanged via LINE_SEL.0x2 : L : When the counter is disabled the PWM outputs"line_out" and "line_compl_out" are driven by the TCPWM.When the counter is disabled or stopped upon a stop event thePWM output "line_out" is driven as a fixed '0' and the PWMoutput "line_compl_out" is driven as a fixed '1'.0x3 : H : When the counter is disabled the PWM outputs"line_out" and "line_compl_out" are driven by the TCPWM.When the counter is disabled or stopped upon a stop event thePWM output "line_out" is driven as a fixed '1' and the PWMoutput "line_compl_out" is driven as a fixed '0'.

[15:14]

reserved_b14to15

0x0

[17:16]

up_down_mode

0x0

Determines counter direction.In QUAD mode this field acts as QUAD_RANGE_MODE field selectingbetween different counter range, reload value and compare /capture behavior.0x0 : COUNT_UP : Count up (to PERIOD). An overflow event isgenerated when the counter changes from a state in whichCOUNTER equals PERIOD. A terminal count event is generated whenthe counter changes from a state in which COUNTER equals PERIOD.0x0 : QUAD_RANGE0 : In QUAD mode this setting selects theQUAD_RANGE0 mode with the following behavior:- COUNTER range is between 0x0000 and 0xFFFF / 0xFFFFFFFF (forCNTWIDTH = 16 / 32)- on reload / index event:- CC0 is copied to CC0_BUFF- COUNTER is copied to CC0- COUNTER is set to midpoint (0x8000 / 0x80000000)- tc and cc0_match events are generated- when COUNTER is 0x0000 or 0xFFFF / 0xFFFFFFFF:- CC0 is copied to CC0_BUFF- COUNTER (0x0000 or 0xFFFF / 0xFFFFFFFF) is copied to CC0- COUNTER is set to midpoint (0x8000 / 0x80000000)- cc0_match event is generated0x1 : COUNT_DOWN : Count down (to "0"). An underflow event isgenerated when the counter changes from a state in whichCOUNTER equals "0". A terminal count event is generated whenthe counter changes from a state in which COUNTER equals "0".0x1 : QUAD_RANGE0_CMP : In QUAD mode this setting selects theQUAD_RANGE0_CMP mode with the following behavior:- COUNTER range is between 0x0000 and 0xFFFF / 0xFFFFFFFF (forCNTWIDTH = 16 / 32)- the capture0 event acts as 2nd reload / index event- on reload / index event:- COUNTER is set to midpoint (0x8000 / 0x80000000)- when 'capture on index' is selected (AUTO_RELOAD_PERIOD=0):- tc event is generated- PERIOD is copied to PERIOD_BUFF- COUNTER is copied to PERIOD- when COUNTER is 0x0000 or 0xFFFF / 0xFFFFFFFF:- COUNTER is set to midpoint (0x8000 / 0x80000000)- when 'capture on wrap-around' is selected(AUTO_RELOAD_PERIOD=1):- tc event is generated- PERIOD is copied to PERIOD_BUFF- COUNTER (0x0000 or 0xFFFF / 0xFFFFFFFF) is copied to PERIOD- 1 or 2 compare functions (depending on CC1_PRESENT) availableBecause of that the PERIOD/PERIOD_BUFF registers are usedinstead of CC0/CC_BUFF registers to capture COUNTER at reload /index event or wrap-around.0x2 : COUNT_UPDN1 : Count up (to PERIOD), then count down (to"0"). An overflow event is generated when the counter changesfrom a state in which COUNTER equals PERIOD. An underflow eventis generated when the counter changes from a state in whichCOUNTER equals "0". A terminal count event is generated whenthe counter changes from a state in which COUNTER equals "0".0x2 : QUAD_RANGE1_CAPT : In QUAD mode this setting selects theQUAD_RANGE1_CAPT mode with the following behavior:- COUNTER range is between 0x0000 and PERIOD- on reload / index event:- COUNTER is set to 0x0000- tc event is generated- when COUNTER is 0x0000 and decrementing:- COUNTER is set to PERIOD- tc event is generated- when COUNTER equals PERIOD and is incrementing:- COUNTER is set to 0x0000- tc event is generated- 1 or 2 capture functions (depending on CC1_PRESENT) available- on capture0 / capture1 event:- CC0 / CC1 is copied to CC0_BUFF / CC1_BUFF- COUNTER value is copied to CC0It allows that the COUNTER register reflects the current angleposition of the rotary encoder, i.e. no MOD or SUB calculationsneed to be done in SW on the COUNTER value to get the currentangle position. This allows a DMA copy of the angle positionfrom the COUNTER register. However, a disadvantage of this modeis that fast sequences of tc interrupts can occur (when encodermoves back and forth around start position). It is recommendedto not use the tc interrupt in this mode.0x3 : COUNT_UPDN2 : Count up (to PERIOD), then count down (to"0"). An overflow event is generated when the counter changesfrom a state in which COUNTER equals PERIOD. An underflow eventis generated when the counter changes from a state in whichCOUNTER equals "0". A terminal count event is generated whenthe counter changes from a state in which COUNTER equals "0"AND when the counter changes from a state in which COUNTERequals PERIOD (this counter direction can be used for PWMfunctionality with asymmetrical updates).0x3 : QUAD_RANGE1_CMP : In QUAD mode this setting selects theQUAD_RANGE1_CMP mode.The behavior is the same as for QUAD_RANGE1_CAPT mode describedabove with the only difference that 1 or 2 compare functions(depending on CC1_PRESENT) are available instead of 1 or 2capture functions.

[18:18]

one_shot

0x0

When '0', counter runs continuous. When '1', counter is turnedoff by hardware when a terminal count event is generated.

[19:19]

reserved_b19

0x0

[21:20]

quad_encoding_mode

0x0

In QUAD mode this field selects the quadrature encoding mode(X1/X2/X4) or the Up / Down rotary counting mode.In PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes, these two bits can be used toinvert "line_out" and "line_compl_out". Inversion is the laststep in generation of "line_out" and "line_compl_out"; i.e. adisabled output line "line_out" has the valueQUAD_ENCODING_MODE[0] and a disabled output line"line_compl_out" has the value QUAD_ENCODING_MODE[1].0x0 : X1 : X1 encoding (QUAD mode)This encoding is identical with an up / down countingfunctionality of the following way: Rising edges of input phiAincrement or decrement the counter depending on the state ofinput phiB (direction input).0x1 : X2 : X2 encoding (QUAD mode)0x1 : INV_OUT : When bit 0 is '1', QUADRATURE_ENCODING_MODE[0]inverts "line_out" (PWM/PWM_DT modes)0x2 : X4 : X4 encoding (QUAD mode)0x2 : INV_COMPL_OUT : When bit 1 is '1',QUADRATURE_ENCODING_MODE[1] inverts "line_compl_out"(PWM/PWM_DT modes)0x3 : UP_DOWN : Up / Down rotary counting mode. Input phiAincrements the counter, input phiB decrements the counter. Thetrigger edge detection settings apply.

[23:22]

reserved_b22tob23

0x0

[26:24]

mode

0x0

Counter mode.0x0 : TIMER : Timer mode0x1 : Reserved1 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x2 : CAPTURE : Capture mode0x3 : QUAD : Quadrature modeDifferent encoding modes can be selected by QUAD_ENCODING_MODEincluding up/down count functionality.Different counter range, reload value and capture behavior canbe selected by QUAD_RANGE_MODE (overloaded field UP_DOWN_MODE).0x4 : PWM : Pulse width modulation (PWM) mode0x5 : PWM_DT : PWM with deadtime insertion mode0x6 : PWM_PR : Pseudo random pulse width modulation0x7 : SR : Shift register mode.

[29:27]

reserved_b27tob29

0x0

[30:30]

dbg_freeze_en

0x0

Specifies the counter behavior in debug mode.'0': The counter operation continues in debug mode.'1': The counter operation freezes in debug mode.

[31:31]

enabled

0x0

Counter enable.'0': counter disabled.'1': counter enabled.Counter static configuration information (e.g. CTRL.mode, allTRIN_CTRL0/1, TRIN_EDGE_SEL, PWM_CTRL and TROUT_SEL registerfields) should only be modified when the counter is disabled.When a counter is disabled, command and status informationassociated to the counter is cleared by HW, this includes:- the associated counter triggers in the CMD register are set to'0'.- the counter's interrupt cause fields in counter's INTRregister.- the counter's status fields in counter's STATUS register..- the counter's trigger outputs ("tr_out0" and tr_out1").- the counter's line outputs ("line_out" and "line_compl_out").

Access

Register

Address

Description

(R-)

TCPWM_group05_STATUS

32'h000001FC

When the counter is disabled (CTRL.enabled = 0), then theSTATUS.tr_* bit fields are typically reset to their defaultvalues. However, there are exceptions possible in the followingcases, based on the selected input trigger via TRIN_SEL*.*_sel:- If a constant '0' is selected, then a '0' is read.- If a constant '1' is selected, then a '1' is read.

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[0:0]

down

0x0

When '0', counter is counting up. When '1', counter is countingdown. In QUAD mode, this field indicates the direction of thelatest counter change: '0' when last incremented and '1' whenlast decremented.

[3:1]

reserved_b1tob3

0x0

[4:4]

tr_capture0

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the selected capture 0 trigger.

[5:5]

tr_count

0x1

Indicates the actual level of the selected count trigger.

[6:6]

tr_reload

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the selected reload trigger.

[7:7]

tr_stop

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the selected stop trigger.

[8:8]

tr_start

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the selected start trigger.

[9:9]

tr_capture1

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the selected capture 1 trigger.

[10:10]

line_out

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the PWM line output signal.

[11:11]

line_compl_out

0x0

Indicates the actual level of the complementary PWM line outputsignal

[14:12]

reserved_b12tob14

0x0

[15:15]

running

0x0

When '0', the counter is NOT running. When '1', the counter isrunning.This field is used to indicate that the counter is running aftera start/reload event and that the counter is stopped after astop event.When a running counter operation is paused in debug state (seeCTRL.dbg_pause) then the RUNNING bit is still '1'.

[31:16]

dt_cnt

0x0

Generic 16-bit counter field. In PWM_DT mode, this counter isused for dead time insertion on PWM line_outIn all other modes, this counter is used for pre-scaling theselected counter clock. PWM_DT mode can NOT use prescaled clockfunctionality.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(RW)

TCPWM_group05_CC0

32'h00000200

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[31:0]

cc0

0xFFFFFFFF

In CAPTURE mode, captures the counter value. In other modes,compared to counter value.Note1: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register withthe internal real value used by counting operation for SW’spurpose under any one of the following conditions:1. SW reads this register when the counter is enabled(CTRL.enabled = 1) already; or2. SW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;Note2: if TCPWM counter is configured as a 16-bit counter, thisregister has bit [15:0] valid only, bit [31:16] is not used.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(RW)

TCPWM_group05_CC1

32'h00000204

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[31:0]

cc1

0xFFFFFFFF

In CAPTURE mode, captures the counter value. In other modes,compared to counter value.Note1: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register withthe internal real value used by counting operation for SW’spurpose under any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;Note2: if TCPWM counter is configured as a 16-bit counter, thisregister has bit [15:0] valid only, bit [31:16] is not used.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(RW)

TCPWM_group05_PERIOD

32'h00000208

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[31:0]

period

0xFFFFFFFF

The maximum value the counter can reach. When the counter isdesigned to count for n cycles, this field should be set ton-1.Note1: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register withthe internal real value used by counting operation for SW’spurpose under any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;Note2: if TCPWM counter is configured as a 16-bit counter, thisregister has bit [15:0] valid only, bit [31:16] is not used.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(RW)

TCPWM_group05_COUNTER

32'h0000020C

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[31:0]

val

0x0

32-bit counter value. It is advised to not write to the thisfield when the counter is running.TCPWM counter can only be initialized by software in PWM_PR andSR mode.Note1: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register withthe internal real value used by counting operation for SW’spurpose under any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;Note2: if TCPWM counter is configured as a 16-bit counter, thisregister has bit [15:0] valid only, bit [31:16] is not used.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group05_PWM_CTRL

32'h00000210

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[1:0]

cc0_match_mode

0x3

Determines the effect of a compare match 0 event (COUNTER equalsCC0 register) on the "line" output signals. Note that INVERT isespecially useful for center aligned pulse width modulation.To generate a duty cycle of 0%, the counter CC0 register shouldbe set to "0". For a 100% duty cycle, the counter CC0 registershould be set to larger than the counter PERIOD register.

[3:2]

overflow_mode

0x3

Determines the effect of a counter overflow event (COUNTERreaches PERIOD) on the "line_out" output signals.

[5:4]

underflow_mode

0x3

Determines the effect of a counter underflow event (COUNTERreaches "0") on the "line_out" output signals.

[7:6]

cc1_match_mode

0x3

Determines the effect of a compare match 1 event (COUNTER equalsCC1 register) on the "line_out" output signals.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(RW)

TCPWM_group05_LINE_SEL

32'h00000214

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[2:0]

out_sel

0x2

Selects the source for the output signal "line_out". Defaultsetting is the PWM signal "line". Other settings are useful forStepper Motor Control.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_PR modes only.Note: The output signal of this selection can be furthermodified by the stop / kill logic and line_out polarity setting(CTRL.quad_encoding_mode[0]).0x0 : L : fixed '0'0x1 : H : fixed '1'0x2 : PWM : PWM signal "line"0x3 : PWM_INV : inverted PWM signal "line"0x4 : Z : The output "line_out" is not driven by the TCPWM.Instead the port default level configuration applies, e.g. "Z"(high impedance).Note: This is realized by driving the output "line_out_en" to 0.0x5 : Reserved5 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x6 : Reserved6 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x7 : Reserved7 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.Note: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register with theinternal real value used by counting operation for SW’s purposeunder any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;

[3:3]

reserved_b3

0x0

[6:4]

compl_out_sel

0x3

Selects the source for the output signal "line_compl_out".Default setting is the inverted PWM signal "line". Othersettings are useful for Stepper Motor Control.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_PR modes only.Note: The output signal of this selection can be furthermodified by the stop / kill logic and line_compl_out polaritysetting (CTRL.quad_encoding_mode[1]).0x0 : L : fixed '0'0x1 : H : fixed '1'0x2 : PWM : PWM signal "line"0x3 : PWM_INV : inverted PWM signal "line"0x4 : Z : The output "line_compl_out" is not driven by theTCPWM. Instead the port default level configuration applies,e.g. "Z" (high impedance).Note: This is realized by driving the output "line_compl_out_en"to 0.0x5 : Reserved5 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x6 : Reserved6 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x7 : Reserved7 : This setting is reserved. Do not use.Note: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register with theinternal real value used by counting operation for SW’s purposeunder any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;

Register

Address

Description

(RW)

TCPWM_group05_PERIOD_BUFF

32'h00000220

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[31:0]

period_buff

0xFFFFFFFF

Additional buffer for counter PERIOD register.In PWM_PR mode PEROD_BUFF defines the LFSR polynomial. Each bitrepresents a tap of the shift register which can be feed backto the MSB of counter via an XOR tree.Examples for CNTWIDTH = 16:- Maximum length 16bit LFSR- polynomial x^16 + x^14 + x^13 + x^11 + 1- taps 0,2,3,5 - > PERIOD_BUFF = 0x002d- period is 2^16-1 = 65535 cycles- Maximum length 8bit LFSR:- polynomial x^8 + x^6 + x^5 + x^4 + 1- taps 8,10,11,12 (realized in 8 MSBs of 16bit LFSR)- period is 2^8-1 = 255 cyclesIn SR mode PERIOD_BUFF defines which tap of the shift registergenerates the PWM output signals. For a delay of n cycles (fromcapture event to PWM output) the bit CNT_WIDTH-n should be setto '1'. For a shift register function only one tap should beuse, i.e. a one-hot value must be written to PERIOD_BUFF. Ifmultiple bits in PERIOD_BUFF are set then the taps are XORcombined.Note1: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register withthe internal real value used by counting operation for SW’spurpose under any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;Note2: if TCPWM counter is configured as a 16-bit counter, thisregister has bit [15:0] valid only, bit [31:16] is not used.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(RW)

TCPWM_group05_LINE_SEL_BUFF

32'h00000224

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[2:0]

out_sel

0x2

Buffer for LINE_SEL.OUT_SEL.Can be exchanged with LINE_SEL.out_sel on a terminal count eventwith an actively pending switch event.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_PR modes only.Note: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register with theinternal real value used by counting operation for SW’s purposeunder any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;

[3:3]

reserved_b3

0x0

[6:4]

compl_out_sel

0x3

Buffer for LINE_SEL.COMPL.OUT_SEL.Can be exchanged with LINE_SEL.compl_out_sel on a terminal countevent with an actively pending switch event.This field has a function in PWM and PWM_PR modes only.Note: TCPWM counter also updates (writes) this register with theinternal real value used by counting operation for SW’s purposeunder any one of the following conditions:SW reads this register when the counter is enabled (CTRL.enabled= 1) already; orSW disables counter by setting CRTL.enable to 0 from 1;

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group05_TRIN_CTRL0

32'h00000228

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[7:0]

capture0_sel

0x0

Selects one of the up to 256 input triggers as a capture0trigger. Input trigger 0 is always '0' and input trigger 1 isalways '1'.In the PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes this trigger is used toswitch the values of the compare and period registers withtheir buffer counterparts.

[15:8]

count_sel

0x1

Selects one of the 256 input triggers as a count trigger.In QUAD mode, this is the first phase (phi A). Default settingselects input trigger 1, which is always '1'.Note: In the modes: TIMER, CAPTURE, PWM, PWM_DT, and SR, If thecounter is externally triggered ( COUNT_SEL > 1), an externaltrigger will be required for each TR_CMD to execute. Forexample, a write to TR_CMD.START will not start the counteruntil the trigger selected by COUNT_SEL asserts. The nexttrigger will increment the counter since the counter is nowrunning. This goes for all TR_CMD fields.

[23:16]

reload_sel

0x0

Selects one of the 256 input triggers as a reload trigger.In QUAD mode, this is the index or revolution pulse. In thesemodes, it will update the counter with 0x8000 (countermidpoint) or 0x0000 depending on the QUAD_RANGE_MODE.

[31:24]

stop_sel

0x0

Selects one of the 256 input triggers as a stop trigger.In PWM, PWM_DT and PWM_PR modes, this is the kill trigger. Inthese modes, the kill trigger is used to either temporarilyblock the PWM outputs (PWM_STOP_ON_KILL is '0') or stop thefunctionality (PWM_STOP_ON_KILL is '1'). For the PWM and PWM_DTmodes, the blocking of the output signals can be asynchronous(STOP_EDGE should be NO_EDGE_DET) in which case the blocking isas long as the trigger is '1' or synchronous (STOP_EDGE shouldbe RISING_EDGE) in which case it extends till the next terminalcount event.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group05_TRIN_CTRL1

32'h0000022C

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[7:0]

start_sel

0x0

Selects one of the 256 input triggers as a start trigger. InQUAD mode, this is the second phase (phi B).

[15:8]

capture1_sel

0x0

Selects one of the 256 input triggers as a capture 1 trigger.

[16:16]

capture0_inv

0x0

Input trigger capture0 will be inverted before counter usage.

[17:17]

count_inv

0x0

Input trigger count will be inverted before counter usage

[18:18]

reload_inv

0x0

Input trigger reload will be inverted before counter usage

[19:19]

stop_inv

0x0

Input trigger stop will be inverted before counter usage

[20:20]

start_inv

0x0

Input trigger start will be inverted before counter usage

[21:21]

capture1_inv

0x0

Input trigger capture1 will be inverted before counter usage

TCPWM_group05_TRIN_EDGE_SEL

32'h00000230

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[1:0]

capture0_edge

0x3

0x0: RISING_EDGE, any rising edge generates an event.0x1: FALLING_EDGE, any falling edge generates an event.0x2: ANY_EDGE, any odd amount of edges generates an event.0x3: NO_EDGE_DET, no edge detection, use trigger as is.

[3:2]

count_edge

0x3

0x0: RISING_EDGE, any rising edge generates an event.0x1: FALLING_EDGE, any falling edge generates an event.0x2: ANY_EDGE, any odd amount of edges generates an event.0x3: NO_EDGE_DET, no edge detection, use trigger as is.

[5:4]

reload_edge

0x3

0x0: RISING_EDGE, any rising edge generates an event.0x1: FALLING_EDGE, any falling edge generates an event.0x2: ANY_EDGE, any odd amount of edges generates an event.0x3: NO_EDGE_DET, no edge detection, use trigger as is.

[7:6]

stop_edge

0x3

0x0: RISING_EDGE, any rising edge generates an event.0x1: FALLING_EDGE, any falling edge generates an event.0x2: ANY_EDGE, any odd amount of edges generates an event.0x3: NO_EDGE_DET, no edge detection, use trigger as is.

[9:8]

start_edge

0x3

0x0: RISING_EDGE, any rising edge generates an event.0x1: FALLING_EDGE, any falling edge generates an event.0x2: ANY_EDGE, any odd amount of edges generates an event.0x3: NO_EDGE_DET, no edge detection, use trigger as is.

[11:10]

capture1_edge

0x3

0x0: RISING_EDGE, any rising edge generates an event.0x1: FALLING_EDGE, any falling edge generates an event.0x2: ANY_EDGE, any odd amount of edges generates an event.0x3: NO_EDGE_DET, no edge detection, use trigger as is.

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_group05_TROUT_SEL

Field

Reset

Description

[2:0]

out0

0x2

Selects one of the internal events to generate the outputtrigger 0. Default setting selects the terminal count event.0x0 : OVERFLOW: Overflow event0x1 : UNDERFLOW: Underflow event0x2 : TC: Terminal count event (default selection)0x3 : CC0_MATCH: Compare match 0 event0x4 : CC1_MATCH: Compare match 1 event0x5 : LINE_OUT: PWM output signal "line_out"0x6 : Reserved6: This setting is reserved. Do not use.0x7: Disabled: Output trigger disabled.

[3:3]

reserved_3

0x0

[6:4]

Do not use.0x7 : Disabled: Output trigger disabled.

TCPWM_group05_TR_CMD

32'h00000238

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[0:0]

capture0

0x0

SW capture 0 trigger. When written with '1', a capture 0 triggeris generated and the HW sets the field to '0' when the SWtrigger has taken effect. It should be noted that the HWoperates on the counter frequency. If the counter is disabledthrough CTRL.ENABLED, the field is immediately set to '0'.

[1:1]

reserved_1

0x0

[2:2]

reload

0x0

SW reload trigger. For HW behavior, see capture0 field.

[3:3]

0x0

SW stop trigger. For HW behavior, see capture0 field.

[4:4]

start

0x0

SW start trigger. For HW behavior, see capture0 field.

[5:5]

capture1

0x0

SW capture1 trigger. For HW behavior, see capture0 field.
