(RW)

TCPWM_DIV_CMD

32'h00000504

clock divider command

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[3:0]

div_sel

0xF

Specifies the clock divider on which the command(enable/disable) is performed. The valid range is 4’h0 ~CDIVNUM-1If div_sel is 4’hF, no clock divider is specified and no clocksignal(s) are generated.

[7:4]

reserved_b4tob7

0x0

[11:8]

pa_div_sel

0xF

pa_div_sel allows a divider to be phase aligned with anotherdivider. E.g., consider a 48 MHz "periClk", and a need for a 12MHz divided clock A and a 8 MHz divided clock B. Clock A usesdivider #0 and is created by aligning it to "periClk"(pa_div_sel is 15) and CLKDIV#0.DIVCTRL.int_div is "4-1". ClockB uses divider #1 and is created by aligning it to clock A(pa_div_sel is 0) and CLKDIV#1.DIVCTRL.int_div "6-1". Thisguarantees that clock B is phase aligned with clock A: as thesmallest common multiple of the two clock periods is 12"periClk" cycles, the clocks A and B will be aligned every 12"periClk" cycles. Note: clock B is phase aligned to clock A,but still uses "periClk" as a reference clock for its dividervalue.NOTE❶: clock divider will be phase aligned to periClk ifpa_div_sel is in the range of CDIVNUM ~ 4’hF.NOTE❷: the clock divider has to be enabled before any otherclock dividers are enabled to have phase alignment with it.

[29:12]

reserved_b12tob29

0x0

[30:30]

disable

0x0

Clock divider disable command (mutually exclusive with enable).SW sets this field to ‘1’ and HW sets this field to ‘0’automatically, the div_sel field specifies which clock divideris to be disabled. If disable command is successful, thespecified clock divider CLKDIV#.DIVSTS.en is 0.NOTE❶: disable bit has to be 0 before SW set it to 1, disablebit will not be cleared when previous divider disablingprocedure is still in processing.NOTE❷: div_sel has to be set before disable bit, disable bitwill automatically be cleared if div_sel is in the invalidrange of CDIVNUM ~ 4’hF

[31:31]

enable

0x0

Clock divider enable command (mutually exclusive with disable).Typically, SW sets this field to '1' to enable a clock dividerand HW sets this field to '0' automatically to indicate thatclock divider enabling has completed. When a clock divider isenabled, its integer and fractional (if present) counters areinitialized to "0". If a clock divider is to be re-enabledusing different integer and fractional divider values, the SWshould follow these steps:

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_OTRIGCLK_CTRL

32'h00000508

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[3:0]

clkdiv_sel

0x0

select the clock gating signal for otrigClk generation from agroup of TCPWM clock dividers.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(P)

TCPWM_GRP_TR_CMD

32'h0000050C

Counter group shared trigger command, this 8-bit triggersignals are sent out of TCPWM IP as output port, they will beconnected back into TCPWM IP as bit[255:248] of 256 inputtriggers bus on SoC side, they are shared by all counters inthe same counter group, the difference between GPR_TR_CMD andindividual counter trigger command TR_CMD is that TR_CMD canonly be used by each counter itself, GPR_TR_CMD is shared byall counters in the same counter group, and TR_CMD will becleared by HW once it takes effect, GPR_TR_CMD is sticky bit,can NOT be cleared by HW. GPR_TR_CMD is mainly used forsynchronized software-based event generation (such as startingmultiple counters synchronously), it is possible by selectingthe same trigger signal in all desired counters (via TRIN_CTRL0and TRIN_CTRL1).

Range

Field

Reset

Description

[0:0]

trigger_0

0x0

SW counter group trigger 0. When written with '1', a trigger isgenerated and the bit won’t be self-cleared until SW clear it.

[1:1]

trigger_1

0x0

SW counter group trigger 1. When written with '1', a trigger isgenerated and the bit won’t be self-cleared until SW clear it.

[2:2]

trigger_2

0x0

SW counter group trigger 2. When written with '1', a trigger isgenerated and the bit won’t be self-cleared until SW clear it.

[3:3]

trigger_3

0x0

SW counter group trigger 3. When written with '1', a trigger isgenerated and the bit won’t be self-cleared until SW clear it.

[4:4]

trigger_4

0x0

SW counter group trigger 4. When written with '1', a trigger isgenerated and the bit won’t be self-cleared until SW clear it.

[5:5]

trigger_5

0x0

SW counter group trigger 5. When written with '1', a trigger isgenerated and the bit won’t be self-cleared until SW clear it.

[6:6]

trigger_6

0x0

SW counter group trigger 6. When written with '1', a trigger isgenerated and the bit won’t be self-cleared until SW clear it.

[7:7]

trigger_7

0x0

SW counter group trigger 7. When written with '1', a trigger isgenerated and the bit won’t be self-cleared until SW clear it.

Access

Register

Address

Description

(RW)
